question: The following is true of TIA except
choices: It is brief episode of neurologic dysfunction
It can be caused by vasospasm
Antiplatelets are indicated for all patients with TIA
The most common cause of TIA is cardiac emboli
answer: The most common cause of TIA is cardiac emboli

question: Regarding peripheral neuropathy which of the following is true?
choices: Autonomic function is normal in most cases

question: Regarding Wallenberg syndrome all of the following are true except
choices: results from lesion in the lateral medulla
There is ipsilateral loss of pain and temperature over the body
There is ipsilateral loss of pain and temperature over the face
Vertigo and nystagmus are common presentation
answer: There is ipsilateral loss of pain and temperature over the body

Which of the following statements regarding the treatment of tuberculosis is incorrect?
choices: Treatment of latent tuberculosis infection (LTBI) can prevent progression to active disease.
A four-drug regimen is typically used for initial treatment of active tuberculosis.
Directly observed therapy (DOT) is not recommended for the treatment of tuberculosis.
Treatment duration for pulmonary tuberculosis is typically six months.
answer: Directly observed therapy (DOT) is not recommended for the treatment of tuberculosis.

question: Which of the following statements correctly describes the clinical course of internal derangement of TMJ
choices: Locking of the jaw is more common than posterior displacement of the disk
Clicking of the joint is less common than locking of the jaw
Pain is less common than locking of the jaw
Clicking , locking and limited opening occur in all cases.
answer: Clicking of the joint is less common than locking of the jaw

question: Which of the following statements correctly describes an epidural hematoma?
choices: Can result from laceration of middle meningeal vein
Can be associated with lucid interval

question: All the followings are commonly used non opiod analgesics except?

answer: B. Approach to Fever & Fever with Rash

question: Choose the INCORRECT statement:
choices: Bacterial infection is a risk factor for seizure
Electrolyte derangments are risk factors for seizure
Normal EEG completely rules out epilepsy
Focal deficit is a feature of seizure
Altered Mental status is feature of seizure
answer: Normal EEG completely rules out epilepsy

question: Which statement is true
choices: Headache is typically the first symptom of a brain tumor
Migraine is more likely to be worsened by the Valsalva maneuver than cluster headache
All migraine headaches are preceded by aura
Tension-type headache commonly awakens patients from sleep
answer: Headache is typically the first symptom of a brain tumor

question: which one of the following is the initial presenting symptom of Parkinson's disease in the majority of patients?
Regarding Myasthenia Gravis, the following are true, EXCEPT?
choices: Edrophonium test is negative in Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome.
Repetitive nerve stimulation shows progressively increasing CMAP amplitude.
Single fiber EMG shows increased jitter.
Thymectomy is a helpful therapeutic modality
Pyridostigmine is helpful for managing symptoms
answer: Repetitive nerve stimulation shows progressively increasing CMAP amplitude

question: Which of the following is the most common complication of bacterial meningitis?
All of the following statements about CSF analysis are correct, EXCEPT:
choices: Bacterial meningitis commonly presents with neutrophilic pleocytosis and hypoglycorrhachia
Opening CSF pressure is usually elevated in patients with meningitis
Normal CSF findings exclude the diagnosis of meningitis.
Cryptococcal meningitis can present with normal CSF glucose.
Viral meningitis typically has normal CSF glucose and elevated protein levels.
answer: Normal CSF findings exclude the diagnosis of meningitis.

question: Which statement is FALSE about the classic triad of symptoms in typhoid fever?

What is the recommended treatment for a patient with active pulmonary tuberculosis and HIV co-infection?
choices: Standard four-drug anti-TB regimen for 6 months.
Standard four-drug anti-TB regimen for 9 months.

answer: Standard four-drug anti-TB regimen plus antiretroviral therapy started within 2 weeks.

question: All of the following are true about the management of Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia (PCP) EXCEPT:
choices: Corticosteroids should be added in severe cases.
Prophylaxis is recommended for all HIV-infected patients.
Alternative treatments include pentamidine and clindamycin-primaquine.
answer: Prophylaxis is recommended for all HIV-infected patients.

question: Which of the following is a common extrapulmonary manifestation of Mycoplasma pneumoniae infection?

choices: It is characterized by abrupt onset of high-grade fever and productive cough.

It is more common in adults than in children.
It is usually self-limited and requires only supportive care.
It is always associated with bacterial co-infection.
answer: It is usually self-limited and requires only supportive care.

question: which of the following is true about herpes simplex esophagitis?

B. Mostly affecting patients with advanced HIV infection

choices: It is defined as a low serum TSH level with normal free T4.

Which of the following statements about chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is TRUE?
choices: It is characterized by reversible airflow obstruction.
It is primarily caused by exposure to noxious particles or gases, especially cigarette smoke.
It always presents with both chronic bronchitis and emphysema.
It is easily diagnosed with pulmonary function tests alone.
It is a disease exclusively affecting the lungs.
answer: It is primarily caused by exposure to noxious particles or gases, especially cigarette smoke.

question: Which of the following is NOT a typical feature of chronic bronchitis?
choices: Productive cough for at least 3 months in each of 2 successive years

question: Which of the following statements regarding the management of acute kidney injury (AKI) is TRUE?
choices: Loop diuretics are effective in improving renal outcomes in all patients with AKI.
Fluid resuscitation should be avoided in patients with AKI.
Renal replacement therapy (RRT) should be initiated in all patients with AKI.
Dopamine is recommended for the prevention or treatment of AKI.
Early identification and treatment of the underlying cause is crucial.
answer: Early identification and treatment of the underlying cause is crucial.

question: What is the primary goal of therapy in patients with nephrotic syndrome?
Which of the following is a key feature that distinguishes prerenal azotemia from acute tubular necrosis (ATN)?
choices: Elevated blood urea nitrogen (BUN) to creatinine ratio
Presence of muddy brown granular casts in urine sediment
answer: Elevated blood urea nitrogen (BUN) to creatinine ratio

Which of the following statements about renal biopsy is TRUE?
choices: It is indicated in all patients with suspected glomerular disease.
It can help differentiate between various types of glomerular diseases.
It is always necessary to determine the cause of AKI.
It is contraindicated in patients with a solitary kidney.
answer: It can help differentiate between various types of glomerular diseases.
